noun.description: A person to whom a bequest is left; a legatee.

adjective.description: Of or relating to a bequest; of the nature of a bequest.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in Record's Grounde of Artes. As noun from classical Latin lēgātārius (in post-classical Latin also legatorius) recipient of a legacy, legatee from lēgātum + -ārius.
